abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated as satisfactory
            and project sustainability is likely. Overall World Bank
            performance was satisfactory: supervision was very closely
            coordinated with the co-financiers, who were enabled to
            solve emerging problems and at the same time, remain firm on
            critical issues. Overall Borrower performance was marginally
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included the following:
            Cooperatively planned and implemented projects based on
            mutual trust between the Bank and the borrower can change
            the way the cooperating parties think about environment and
            development issues. The stronger the commitment at various
            levels within the Borrower country, the Bank, and the
            donors/co-financiers, the better the result. This project
            reconfirmed the findings of earlier completed projects that
            it is important to ensure continuity of the task
            managers/task team leaders and the composition of the task
            teams. The project also reconfirmed that transforming an
            existing water and wastewater utility developed in a
            centrally planned economy into an efficiently managed
            self-sustaining entity, and introducing modern corporate
            management ideas are much more challenging tasks than
            physical implementation of the project. In similar projects,
            special emphasis should be placed on institutional capacity building.
